description.p: Relationships between ARM concepts represented into the graphical view shall be oriented in order to facilitate the understanding of the data planning model
Third sentence: The words "may" and "either" are not acceptable here. Normative definitions are needed on how to implement this part of ISO 10303.

Change the sentence to: "The file format shall be encoded according to either the syntax and EXPRESS language mapping defined in ISO 10303-21 and in the MIM referenced in A.2 of this part of ISO 10303.

No global rules are defined to constrain the MIM population according to the ARM. In the long form in total 17 rules are found. We expect at least a few hundred to ensure all ARM constraints. Without these rules it will not be possible to verify if a MIM population fir to the ARM constraints.

Generate all needed global rules automatically by a suitable program to ensure that every constraint on the ARM side is ensured of the MIM side. This includes relations between objects, sub-supertpye constraints, compliance with reference path in mapping table.

This issue is on the old dispute on mapped_item and representation_map on the one hand and representation_relationship_with_transformation and item_defined_transformation on the other hand. Which one is the right or correct one to use? The point is that we need two different ways to geometrically relate 2 objects with each other (with transformation). The difference between the two ways is that one establishes a geometrical assembly (this is one shape is included in the other) while the other way only establishes a relation without including one shape in the other. As an example let us assume a geometric_model A of a house with garden and parking place. There is another geometric model B of a car. Now we want to geometrically relate A and B to show how the car fits to the parking place. Neither is A is included in B nor is B included in A. It is essential that both ways are supported by part 1004.

Proposal A which is conformant with the AIM: Introduce the mapped_item + representation_map concept in the ARM because this clearly defines inclusion of one representation in the other. For the case that only two representations shall be related with each other without establishing an inclusion use the representation_relationship_with_transformation. Proposal B: Rename both 4.3.9 and 4.3.10 to be just a relation instead of a mapping. When using these entities we can then defined whether they define an inclusion or just a simple relation.

Major concept of mapped_item is missing. The entities representation_relationship_with_transformation + item_defined_transformation allows to relate shape_representations without including one into the other. However for geometric assembly mapped_item+representation map is essential.
Add mapped_item and representation_map and make it the default for the case of geometric assembly.
There may be no id for an Organization available
Make Organization.id optional as it is in part41.
It is not fully clear how to use prefix_title
Add a note to say that typical prefix_titles are "Mr.", "Mrs." and "Dr." or combinations.

There is a big overlap between product_category and class. From the evolution of STEP it must be clear that product_category shall only be used for AP-specify categories, but not for typical application data. In the latter case Class (10303-1070) even for products has to be used.

Change introduction to "This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of structured hierarchies of AP or module specific categories for products." 4.1.1 Change to "A Product_category is a type of product for AP or module specific purpose." Add a note: "For the purpose of a general classification of products use entity Class and Classification_assignment ISO 10303-1070 and -1114". (where In 4.1.1 change the example to "part" and "document". An alternative would to remove this module completely - it is not really needed!

Currently both "id" and "name" are mandatory. However it is often the case that some CAD/PDM system holds internally only one string. Then these systems have to invent some random string for the other attribute. This complicates data exchange because the receiving system can not distinguish which attribute is real and which is random.
We strongly propose to have one attribute optional - our choice is to make "name" optional. Consequently "id" must be a non-empty string
To be able to distinguish products from each other it is essential that the "id" of products must be unique within some scope, e.g. an exchange file or within a database.
Add a unique rule for "id". This may be combined with id-owner.

For exchange purpose, but also for data integration it is absolutely essential that the owner of the id of a product is always specified. The owner may be a person, an organization or some system. It must be a requirement for every pre-processor to ensure proper product id and id-owner.
Add an inverse attribute "id_owner" for a person_organization_assignment in the role "id_owner" to ensure that there is exactly one id-owner specified.

It makes no sense to include this artificial entity. From an industrial practises point of view it is also clear that the attribute "products" of product_related_product_category (AIM) is defined in the wrong direction. For compatibility reasons it is not possible to modify the AIM. However for the modular ARM this is possible.
Add a new attribute "categories" as a set of 1 to many product categories to product. Update the mapping accordingly.
As a minimal industrial requirement the "id" of all versions of a product must be distinct. Only one version may have an empty string.
Add a unique rule for product_version
The AIM concept product:_definition_formation is more generic than just versioning a product. Especially it may be used to characterize the product at different life-cycle states.
Add a note to the attribute "id" to say that the id may be an empty string
Since attribute relation_type is constraint in further subtypes we have to ensure that these subtype are used for the constraint values.
Add a rule to ensure that for the relation types "supplied item" and "supplied document'" the subtype Supplied_part_relationship is used always.
As a minimal industrial requirement for data exchange the ids of all product_view_definitions of a product_version must be distinct from each other.
Add a unique rule for "id, defined_version". This also ensures that one id may be an empty string.
The categories "part" and "raw_material" are supported, but not "tool". Missed the more generic concept Item
It is not clear if it is valid to refer a Part by a product_version with attribute of_product which is not a part_version.
Add a rule to Part to ensure that part is only referenced by part_version, but not by it's supertype product_version or other subtypes of it.
It is not clear if it is valid to refer a Part_version by product_view_definitions which are not part_view_definitions.
Enforce that Part_version can not be referenced by product_view_definitions which are not part_view_definitions.
Whenever an Alias_identification is given it should be clear to whom the Alias-id belongs to
Add a rule to ensure that an alias_id must be referenced by a person_or_organization assignment in the role id_owner.

Form the current structure of integrated resources the mapping must go to mapped_item. Only this ensures inclusion of the replication. Representation_relationship_with_transformation with item_defined_transformation does only relate two models without including the one in the other.
Change mapping to mapped_item and representation_map or fix the problem in a generic way. See our proposal B on part 1004
This definition "id: the identifier that distinguishes the View_definition_relationship" makes little sense as long as it is not clear within which scope the id shall be distinguishable.
Either add specification of the unique scope or otherwise (preferable) make id optional.
An Activity may have only a name, but no id. This is also the case in the AIM
Provide a list of typical status to be used
It is not clear if a Document can be referenced by Product_versions which are not Document_versions.
Add a rule to ensure that every Product_version, referencing the Document is a Document_version.

A product_as_individual can't be a subtype of product_version it must be a product by its own. This is because even individual products change over time it is essential that several product_versions are even available for individual products. It is open if a special subtype of product_version, e.g. product_version_as_individual is needed. However Product_as_planned and Product_as_realized should still be (indirect) subtypes of Product_version. Note that a product_as_individual, e.g. a house, may have more than one design. There was probably a design when the house was build initially. But when the house get later renovated a totally new or only partial design is made. It is still the same house in 2 (as realized) versions, initial and renovated. Each version may have its independent design, which are not related with each other.

Make product_as_individual a subtype of product. Add a note saying that the product.id may be used for the serial number of this product. Update the other ARM objects and of this class and the mapping accordingly. Remove IP1 from 4.3.4 Product_design_to_individual.
For the sentence "A Breakdown is also a Product ..." it is not clear what the meaning of the word "also" is.
Write "A Breakdown is a product by its own ..."
The introduction missed to explain the relationship between a Breakdown and a Breakdown_element (Breakdown_context).

Breakdonw_of stands in a 1:1 relation with Breakdown_version. This indicates that Breakdown_of has no semantic reason to exist on the ARM level. Also it is fully unclear what to do with the attributes id, name, description. They are all available for Breakdown and Breakdown_version already. There is no need to introduce further artificial attributes for which no justification is given.
Remove entity Breakdown_of and add instead an optional attribute of_view to Breakdown_version.
Uof name syntax is not allowed (<uof name="-">)
The mapping syntax "applied_attribute_classification_assignment.items[i] = attribute_classification_item" is incorrect.
The mapping syntax action_method_assignment.role = action_method_role is incorrect
Attribute mapping result aim entity is not specified

The mapping is incomplete: cartesian_transformation_operator_3d <= cartesian_transformation_operator [cartesian_transformation_operator.axis1 -> direction] [cartesian_transformation_operator.axis2 -> direction] [cartesian_transformation_operator_3d.axis3 -> direction]

Should be fixed to: cartesian_transformation_operator_3d <= cartesian_transformation_operator [cartesian_transformation_operator.axis1 -> direction] [cartesian_transformation_operator.axis2 -> direction] [cartesian_transformation_operator_3d.axis3 -> direction] direction

The mapping syntax is incorrect: envelope <= [product] {product <- product_related_product_category.products[i] product_related_product_category <= product_category product_category.name='envelope' } [characterized_object]

Should be substituted with: [envelope <= product {product <- product_related_product_category.products[i] product_related_product_category <= product_category product_category.name='envelope' }] [envelope <= characterized_object]
The mapping syntax is incorrect: applied_event_occurrence_assignment <= event_occurrence_assignment applied_event_occurrence_assignment.items[i] -> event_occurrence_item
Should be substituted with: applied_event_occurrence_assignment <= event_occurrence_assignment <- applied_event_occurrence_assignment.items[i] -> event_occurrence_item
The statement "/SUPERTYPE(Measure_item)/" is not a valid entity
The relation between interface_connection and product_definition_relationship is undefined product_definition_relationship => interface_connection {product_definition_relationship
The relation should be defined in such a way: product_definition_relationship => interface_connection => product_definition_relationship {product_definition_relationship

The mapping is incomplete: applied_effectivity_context_assignment applied_effectivity_context_assignment <- effectivity_context_role effectivity_context_role.name = 'product as individual effectivity'

applied_effectivity_context_assignment => effectivity_context_assignment effectivity_context_assignment.role -> effectivity_context_role effectivity_context_role.name = 'product as individual effectivity'
Not one Global Rule is defined for the AP. An AP of this complexity needs probably more than 100 global rules to avoid and detect invalid data
Add all global rules in the AIM needed to a) ensure the ARM constraints and b) eliminating invalid ANDOR combinations and c) ensuring correct subtyping of entities.
The AP239 DIS Validation report does not contain any concrete example of an AP239 data set. It only refers to documents not accessible for the national bodies of TC184/SC4
Either add detailed examples to the validation report or make those examples available as regular TC184/SC4 documents.
AP239 will not only be used for data exchange but also for data integration. Therefore it is needed to add SDAI as a valid implementation method.
Add 10303-22 and its language bindings as valid implementation method

The state_relationship attributes related and relating are SETs of states. This is very unusual in the overall STEP modeling (see also 10303-41 E.3 Relationship template: object_relationship). The semantic of subtypes of state_relationship becomes by this very questionable. Grouping of states can always be achieved by composition_of_state. We have to avoid redundant mechanisms to achieve things.
Change attributes related and relating to be of type state (not SET of state).

State_definition_relationship has SETs for the related and relating attribute. This is very unusual for STEP (see reasons in above above). Also there is a redundant mechanism with composition_of_state_definition
Change attributes related and relating to be of type state_definition (not SET of state).
Entity location: The word "even" in the first sentence is not correct here. Maybe "event" is meant.
Entity location. The attribute alternative_loacation_representation is a select of exactly one location, but the text says one or more. Also there may be cases when no representation may be known.
Change attribute alternative_location_representation to SET[0:?] of location_representation.

Entity address_based_location_representation. It is not understandable why the postale-address is of type address_assignment which requires a person or organization. There are cases when we simply want to specify a house or real_estate only by its address not knowing about a specific person or organization at this address; e.g. for maintenance of the water meter in a multi flat house.
Remove entity address_based_location_representation and extend instead select 4.2.2.location_representation by address and address_assignment.

Entity product_based_location_identification: It is not clear what is the difference between location_identification and location_value. A seat number is given as an example for both. In practice such values may not be known
Provide better explanations of these attributes or merge them into one. Make them optional.

A Justification is in no way a product. Justification has to be mapped to something appropriate. But since the ARM definition is rather week (it is not fully clear what is meant with Justification and in which context to use it) it is not easy to figure out what the right AIM entity would be.
If no useful entity from current integrated resources can be identified new integrated resources have to be created.

a) Product_as_individual must be a subtype of product (not of product_version) since it has it's own unique product name and id. b) Product_as_planed and product_as_realized define specific life-cycle-domains of a product. Consequently they must be subtypes of product_definition_view and map to suptypes of product_definition c) On the AIM level product_as_indiviual and at least one of its major views must be compatible with physical_instance from AP214

a) Make product_as_individual a subtype of product b) make product_as_realized and product_as_planed subtypes of product_view_definition. Map "as_realized" and "as_planed" to product_definition_context.life_cycle_contex. c) change mapping of product_as_individual to ensure that product_category.name = 'physically realized product' d) make corresponding changes for product_planned_to_realized. E.g. map to product_definition_relationship

Entity product_group_relationship: The statement "Classification_assignment is used to specify the meaning or type of the relationship." Is very problematic. One requirement is e,g, to establish a sub-group such, that the member of the sub-group are also members of the super-group. To process the particular ROLE must be directly part of this entity.
Remove the quoted sentence. Either a) add a role attribute and specify some relationships such as sub-super or b) provide specific subtypes for different kinds of relationships.

a) Electrical connections between components is the domain of AP210 and AP212. b) This module mixes up two different concepts, the one on usage_view and design_view (black/white box) and the concept of connectors and connections. It is essential to separate these concepts.

a) Harmonize the concept of a connector and connections with AP210 and AP212 b) Rename this module to "Connector" c) create a new module on usage- and design_view to clearly separate the "interface" concept from the internal "design" concept. See AP210 for details.
A connector is not a specific product by it's own. Instead a connector is only a specific view of a product.
Remove entities interface_specification and interface_connector. Rename interface_connector_definition to Connector
A slot is only a specific view of a product. It is not a product or product_version by its own.
Totally re-model this module. Make entity slot a subtype of product_view_definition. Don't have specific subtypes from product and product_version.

Entity attribute_translation_assignment: It makes no sense that considered_instances allows to refer to more than one entity_instance. This would indirectly make all string attributes objects which can be grouped together
Change to singular case sonsidered_instance and remove the SET:

The current data model does not allow for an automatic computer interpretation of a condition. The given example makes this quite obvious. The essential information of a condition is stored in a string instead of referencing the appropriate attributes. Entity condition_parameter is very insuffient for this
Extend the data model, so that a condition can be applied to one or more properties of a product or other items, together if the needed expression (math schema in 10303-50 and PLIB-20).
The kind of condition_relationship shall be directly included in an additional attribute "role" or in subtype information. Otherwise such information cannot be automatically processes.
Entity task must be a subtype of activity instead of activity_method. Also task_assignment must be subtype of applied_activity_assignment Otherwise we would have a major conflict with AP214.

Do as proposed and map ARM action to executed_action and ARM task_assignment to applied_action_assignment. Consequently further changes on task_state_relationship and others are needed to complete this.
Have a common supertype of all kinds of properties, including activity_property and independent_property.

The scope of the standard is not clear. It is not clear were the distinction to e.g. AP 233 is. Something like a competition with other APs is wasting resources and should be avoided, e.g. System Product Structure & Functional Product Structure [ISO 10303-1216 ] should be domiciled in AP233.
Please improve the scope and describe a clear separation to other emerging standards.

In SC4 Standing Document (N1686), "Guidelines for the content of application protocols that use application modules", 4.4 describes as follows for the content of Scope of Modular AP document.
"Clause 1 of an AP shall define the domain of the AP and summarize the fundamental concepts and assumptions of the scope, the functionality of the AP, and the types of information that are accommodated by the AP. A description of the functionality and information that are specifically outside the scope of the application shall be defined to clarify the domain of the AP."
N1686 also describes as follows by NOTE 2 in 4.4.
"The required text of the scope clause is generated by the SC4 Module Repository. The scope bullets are derived from the AP Module. Paragraphs describing the domain of application are added by the AP editor."
The current Scope clause of AP239 describes only functions that are derived from AP Module. It does not include any descriptions about domain of the AP nor fundamental concepts that will be useful for the readers of this document.

It is recommended to add such descriptions as follows in the context of within the scope and outside the scope.
1) Main activities of AAM within the scope, e.g. titles of activities of A0 diagram -to manage information to support a product -to generate support solutions -to commission support system -to provide support
2) Information model to support industrial domain specific application is outside the scope.
3) Which of life cycle stages is within the scope, and which is outside the scope.

The ARM EXPRESS index and the module index are displayed in the left side frame when the word "index" is clicked for HTML version.
The description of 4.7.2 in SC4 Standing Document (N1686), "Guidelines for the content of application protocols that use application modules" does not mention how to display the index.
What kind of presentation of index will be provided to readers who print out a modular AP document?

ARM entity "Slot" is defined in "Attachment_slot" module developed for AP239 as follows.
"A Slot is a type of Product that represents the position in which a part is or can be attached to a parent product."
There is another ARM entity "Slot" defined in AP224 with a different meaning in the domain of a numerical controlled machine. This may cause a problem if the next version of AP224 is planned to be developed using the modular architecture, namely one of these ARM entity names may have to be changed to avoid a name clash. Does it mean that the ARM entity name in the later AM has to be changed even if it was established in the corresponding traditional AP?

Harmonization should be ensured between ISO/TC 184/SC5 and SC4 standards in general, and the ISO TC184 SC4 standard regarding Product Life Cycle Support (PLCS) in particular. To be able to establish the standard widely in industry this must be resolved.
The select-type Assigned_name_select contains only one select item: External_class_library. It seems desirable that the select-type is as rich as comparable ones, e.g., Identification_item.
Update the model or the documentation.

It is currently possible to represent numerical values with unit and string values. The representation of values without units, of booleans, logicals, and binaries seem to be missing. How should, e.g., a value of probability be described (in the ARM)?

There is a requirement to specify which type of identification another identification system provides an alias for. Currently Alias_identification only points at the thing that is given an alias id, but does not relate to the other ids.
Either Alias_identification should get an optional link to an Identification_assignment, or Alias_identification.items can be assigned directly to an Identification_assignment.

Currently Assigned_property can not be reused. If a type of property and a specific value apply to more than one instance of product data (property_assignment_select), both Assigned_property and Property_representation need to be instantiated repeatedly. This leads to an undesired and unnecessary proliferation of data.
Make Assigned_property.described_element an aggregate or at least Property_representation.property.

Consider the name of a unit to be classified this way. With the current solution, each instance of unit, the name of which is supposed to be in the class of unit names, requires an instance of Attribute_classification (each of which relates to the same Class). With an aggregate type attribute this proliferation of Attribute_classification instances would be avoided.
It seems that this attribute would better be of an aggregate type (SET for example).

It should be made clearer when the concepts for assembly shall be used to build a product structure and when the concepts for breakdown. Which are the criteria to decide for the one or the other? It seems to be possible to represent an assembly structure by using the breakdown concepts.
How should the number of members of a group be modelled? Is the use of Assigned_property adequate or are there other means?
We feel that the number of members is not a property, but a value that is derived from the nature of the group. Something like a derived property would probably be adequate.

Currently Events may only be assigned to two concepts: Certification and Project. May not "all" kinds of product data be subject to an Event? Guidance seems to exist to use Activity instead of Event. This is not obvious from the documentation of the standard.
Update the documentation to make the distinctions in the use of Event and Activity clear.
In the definitions of the attributes parent_/child_element the term 'functional element' should probably read 'zonal element'.
It is currently not possible to classify attributes of entity Physical_element and similar, but there may be requirements to classify the names of such.
It shall be possible to assign dates to State_transition.

It should be possible to assign not only a string as a start_id to an effectivity, but also the instance directly. The same id-string may be used in different context so that the instance may not be identified unambiguously.
A solution similar to the Product_as_individual_effectivity is required. start_id and end_id both need to refer to the instance itself, not to an id.

Qualified_property_value_representation refers to Unit through both Numerical_item_with_unit and Numerical_representation_context. Though the two references to units are related, no rule seems to control their correct population.
Add a rule to Qualified_property_value_representation to control the correct use of Unit.
It should be possible to assign an identifier to a Breakdown_element_usage.
Add Breakdown_element_usage to the Identification_item select list.

Observation_item identifies an item by its string-type identifier. The same id-string may be used in different context to identify different instances; an Observation_item may not identify an instance unambiguously.

Allow, at least in addition, the identification of an instance directly, by a pointer. If this is not possible, Observation_item should get an additional attribute "identifier_role" that when being populated shall correspond to a Identification_assignment.role .

It seems that ..._assignment.role attributes shall not be populated. Instead their values shall be given as External_class.name of a Classification_assignment. This needs to b well documented in the standard, probably in the fundamentals section.
(if not done already ...) Update the documentation.
It should be possible to assign the same document to several product data items. That is, the is_assigned_to-attribute should be an aggregate, not, as currently, a single valued attribute.

According to the current model, Assigned_property can not be assigned to Product_version_relationship. Instead a View_definition_relationship shall be created and the Assigned_property assigned to it.
Update the documentation of the model accordingly, that is, specifically for Product_version_relationship.
According to the current model, Task can not be assigned to Product_version_relationship. Instead a View_definition_relationship shall be created and the Task assigned to it.
Update the documentation of the model accordingly, that is, specifically for Task.
It should be possible to assign a document to a String_representation_item. The document may serve as the source/description of a string value.

It should be possible to assign an Attribute_classification to an attribute in a Class. Example: All values shall be assigned their origin, i.e., the names of table and field in a database. These values may be hold almost anywhere in the PLCS model, also in Class.name or Class.description .

It should be possible to assign a document to an External_source_identification. Example: A document may originate from a software application. The application may be represented as an instance of External_source_identification. Or is this a misuse of the Document_assignment concept? Somehow it should be possible to assign the source of a document.
It should also be possible to assign Product_category to Tasks and Organizations (and maybe others). This would ensure a consistent way of handling categorization in STEP.

It should be possible to assign approvals to relationships like Product_version_relationship and View_definition_relationship. It seems not sufficient to approve only the related or relating. Several relationship instances may involve the same related or relating. Also Product_view_definition should be subject to approval.
Include Product_version_relationship, View_definition_relationship, and Product_view_definition in Approval_item.
Document_definition should not be abstract. In some cases one does not know whether a document is physical or digital.
Remove the abstract constraint or introduce an instantiable subtype that may be digital or physical.
It should be possible to assign identifiers to Product_based_location_identifications. It should also be possible to classify Product_based_location_identifications, both attributes.
Include Product_based_location_identification in Identification_item, Classification_item, and Classified_attribute_select (at least those three).
It should be possible to classify entities of type State_role. Example: State_role.name may be 'document status' or 'revision status'. One may want to make these strings to reference data.

It should be possible to classify entity data types Activity_property_representation and Resource_property_representation (as it is possible to classify Property_representation). The role-attribute is the reason for why classification makes sense.
Include Activity_property_representation and Resource_property_representation in Classification_item.
Why does Product_based_location_representation only include Product, not Product_version? A location may change from Product_as_planned to Product_as_realized, for example.
It should be possible to assign dates to Product_version_relationship, as it currently is to assign to Product_version.

WR4 says that there shall not be two Document_property_representation instances with the same name; only four names are valid. How is it then possible to use Numerical_representation_context for Numerical_document_property and a normal Representation_context for Descriptive_document_property if they all shall be in the same items-set of Document_property_representation which only has a single context_of_items attribute? Or is it not foreseen to have a mixed items-set? Or shall they all use the same simple Representation_context?

This entity data type seems to be over-constrained! It seems to be tailored for shape related documents. Is it supposed to support text documents as well? What about a property like "number of lines in document"? If this entity data type shall not be applicable to represent all kinds of document properties, its name and description should make this clear.
It should be possible to assign a property to a Partial_document_assignment. Example: from and to page that identify the relevant part of the document could be represented by a property.
Include Partial_document_assignment in Property_assignment_select. Alternatively add attributes to Partial_document_assignment to specify the part of a document that shall be assigned to something.

It should be possible to assign an identifier to a Document_assignment. Example: index of a material list item in a material list may be represented as an identifier of the Document_assignment that connects the material list document to the Physical_element that is the material itself.
It should be possible to classify an Organization_type (for obvious reasons).

It should be possible to assign an Activity to an Assigned_property. This is to say more about the method how a value was calculated than what Qualified_property_value_representation.value_determination can express.

According to WR1 all Measure_items shall be referenced by Representation.items . Required_resource.required_quantity is an attribtue of type Measure_item. How is the WR1-constraint supposed to be fulfilled? The same question applies to Resource_as_realized, Resource_event, etc.

2 years ago it was considered that at the A-0/AO level of the model that a generic 'feedback' line was sufficient to indicate an input activity that needed action type work. Activity box A1 maintained this simple generic name instead of 'hundreds of types'. A1 now identifies a Task Feedback (TF) input to box A11 The TF arrow definition "information, in any form, derived from observation of a realized activity including progress, findings or resource use, prior to the capture of this information in the format required by the IM rules" seems inappropriate in areas of the model in which it is used For example on A113 'Evaluate and Co-ord Solution and Variance TF is used to bring 2 (two) feedback returns; business impact of solution and solution definition report into 1131, and 1132,1133. The requests were issued 'under' IM rules therefore TF is inappropriate or the definition is incorrect

2 years ago it was considered that at the A-0/AO level of the model that a generic 'feedback' line was sufficient to indicate an input activity that needed action type work. Why is OF required when it dealt with within the AAM as Support Feedback "information provided to support authorities by operators including information on product health and usage, and equipment problems discovered by operators - May include trouble reports, log books and other data from on board recording systems, passed to support authorities for analysis. The operator feedback is structured to conform to the information management rules by activity A4.4 and is communicated within this model by the support feedback arrow."
Revert to 'feedback', "information of relevance to support that is derived from experience or observation - I
Manage Issue definition incorrect "action top record and assess issues according to type and priority" Delete the 'p' to make it read correctly
"Action to record and assess issues according to type and priority"

The definition of variance has changed from the CM agreed definition in 2.13 NOW - a departure from the design intent as specified by the Assured Product and Support Information WAS - A departure from the design intent as reflected in the Assured Product and Support Information.

Arrow Note: 1. Design Intent includes the design of the support system, the manufacturing system etc. Acceptance of a Variance does not change the PIF baseline. 2. Different organizations have one or more words to describe departures from the design baseline, thus this definition is intended to cover terms such as: waiver, concession, non-conformance, production permit, acceptable fault etc.

The concept of probability in the Probability module is not rich enough to meet the mathematical definition. This definition involves an "experiement" (e.g. roll a die) and an "outcome" of that experiment (e.g. the probability of a odd number when rolling a die). Each outcome has a probability, arising from an examination of the elementary events that can result from the experiment (e.g. the six individual values given by rolling a die). The experiment can be complex (e.g. roll the die, if the die is even, roll again, if the die is even, roll again) and the definition of the outcome can be complex (e.g. the value of the die is 1, 4 or 5). Nothing in the Probability module requires the identification of both the experiment and outcome.

In SysML you don't have to name every connector but in the Interface modules you do. So, I end up creating dummy Interface_connector, Interface_connector_version and Interface_connector_definition instances for each connector with names like "Anonymous Connector 1 on R1 in Low-pass filter" for the Interface connector and appending "Version 1" and then "Version 1 Definition 1" for the version and definition. While this is tedious I can accept that STEP wants to make explicit what is implicit in the SysML diagram. Then you add instances of Connector_on to relate the Interface_connector_definition to the item it's attached to which is either a Product_view_definition or a View_definition_relationship and while tedious, this also works.

However, when the connector has a name in SysML, like "Input on Low-pass filter" there's a problem. You create the Interface_connector, Interface_connector_version and Interface_connector_definition and say is is on the Product_view_definintion named "Low-pass filter Version 1 Definition 1". The problem arises when "Low-pass filter Version 1 Definition 1" is used as a component "F1" in a higher level assembly like Filter Circuit. It turns out that you cannot reuse the definition "Input on Low-pass filter" wrt "F1" when you are making a Interface_connection instance... you can only do that between Interface_connector_definitions. The only workaround seems to be to have to create "duplicate" instances of Interface_connector, Interface_connector_version and Interface_connector_definition for each use of a named Interface_connector. This is a problem because "Input on Low-pass filter Version 1 Definition 1" and "Input on F1 Low-pass filter in Filter Circuit Version 1 Definition 1" are really the same connector definition.

On the above diagram it boils down to the fact that when connecting "S1" and "Input" on "F1" in "Filter Circuit", I am forced to treat "Input" on "F1" in "Filter Circuit" as completely unrelated to the definition of "Input" on "Low-pass filter" when they are clearly the same definition (i.e. they would have the same properties, etc.).

The only solution I can come up with is to allow Interface_connection to refer to Connector_on as well as Interface_connector_definition given the current structure but that doesn't make sense as Interface_connection is a kind of View_definition_relationship. So, a rethink might be more in order. Perhaps Interface_connection is not a kind of View_definition_relationship?

In STEP, Breakdowns seems to be thought of as quite different from Assemblies and that's why the Product_breakdown module and System_breakdown module do not use the entity type Next_assembly_usage but instead created a separate entity type called Breakdown_element_usage.
The use of Breakdown_element_usage is one reason why System_breakdown cannot be used for the SysML to STEP mapping - because there is quantity attribute.

A second reason seems to stem from the text found in the Product_breakdown introduction which says "These views are complementary to the assembly structure and bill of materials views that are the primary focus for manufacturing (realization) of a product (see Part definition relationship ). Breakdowns may be of designs or realized individual products. For any product, more than one breakdown may exist to support various different engineering activities." where I added the bold. If Systems engineers create "assembly structure" then this seems to say they should not use Product_breakdown.
Is the intent for the current Breakdown modules to be harmonized/reusable between AP239 and AP233? If so, they seem not to satisfy AP233 requirements in this area.
Here are a few options... there may be more:

ol.li: Change System_breakdown (and perhaps all Breakdowns to use the same structures as STEP Assembly uses);
Create modules for System_definition or something like that which works for AP233 but not AP239;
Use Product, Product_view_definition,etc. and categorize/classify them as a "System" and "System engineering view" etc;
Create a patch module that allows Next_assembly_usage or similar to apply to System_breakdown_element saying not to use Breakdown_element_usage in AP233.

description.p: In SysML a Port (i.e. Interface_connector in STEP) is a kind of Part (i.e. Product in STEP). Therefore, Ports appear as normal Parts in the assembly structure. In AP239, it seems that the idea of an Interface_connector being part of an assembly requires two sets of relationships, first the Next_assembly_usage is needed to make the it part of the assembly and then Connector_on is needed to link the definition of the connector to the definition of the assembly. The modules do not provide clear guidance as to whether this duplication is expected or whether there is an error in the way Connector_on works.
Determine if Connector_on makes something part of an "assembly" and update the documentation or the model or both as appropriate.

In SysML, not all Ports (i.e STEP connectors) are required to be defined. In the example diagram, Resistor has two "anonymous" Ports. However, in STEP these Ports are required to be created as Interface_connector_defintion (and Interface_connector_version and Interface_connector). As there is no name in the SysML diagram they are "anonymous". For the mapping we did, we generated names such as "Anonymous connector 1 on Version 1 of Definition 1 ... ". This creation of explicit instances is caused by the fact that STEP only allows Interface_connection between two Interface_connector_definition instances.
Do not require explicit instantiation of unmodeled ports. It seems like something such as allowing Interface_connection between Interface_connector_definition and Next_assembly_usage might work.
